org.jasig.cas.extension.clearpass

Class EncryptedMapDecorator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jasig.cas.extension.clearpass.EncryptedMapDecorator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>
    Deprecated. 
    As of 4.1, use CacheCredentialsMetaDataPopulator instead.

    @Deprecated
public final class EncryptedMapDecorator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>
    Decorator for a map that will hash the key and encrypt the value.
    Since:
    1.0.6

    • Constructor Detail

      • EncryptedMapDecorator

        public EncryptedMapDecorator(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> decoratedMap)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Deprecated. 
        Decorates a map using the default algorithm DEFAULT_HASH_ALGORITHM and a DEFAULT_ENCRYPTION_ALGORITHM.

        The salt is randomly constructed when the object is created in memory. This constructor is sufficient to decorate a cache that only lives in-memory.

        Parameters:
        decoratedMap - the map to decorate. CANNOT be NULL.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the algorithm cannot be found. Should not happen in this case, or if the key spec is not found or if the key is invalid. Check the exception type for more details on the nature of the error.

      • EncryptedMapDecorator

        public EncryptedMapDecorator(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> decoratedMap,
                     java.lang.String salt,
                     java.lang.String secretKey)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Deprecated. 
        Decorates a map using the default algorithm DEFAULT_HASH_ALGORITHM and a DEFAULT_ENCRYPTION_ALGORITHM.

        Takes a salt and secretKey so that it can work with a distributed cache.

        Parameters:
        decoratedMap - the map to decorate. CANNOT be NULL.
        salt - the salt, as a String. Gets converted to bytes. CANNOT be NULL.
        secretKey - the secret to use for the key. Gets converted to bytes. CANNOT be NULL.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the algorithm cannot be found. Should not happen in this case, or if the key spec is not found or if the key is invalid. Check the exception type for more details on the nature of the error.

      • EncryptedMapDecorator

        public EncryptedMapDecorator(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> decoratedMap,
                     java.lang.String hashAlgorithm,
                     java.lang.String salt,
                     java.lang.String secretKeyAlgorithm,
                     java.lang.String secretKey)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Deprecated. 
        Decorates a map using the provided algorithms.

        Takes a salt and secretKey so that it can work with a distributed cache.

        Parameters:
        decoratedMap - the map to decorate. CANNOT be NULL.
        hashAlgorithm - the algorithm to use for hashing. CANNOT BE NULL.
        salt - the salt, as a String. Gets converted to bytes. CANNOT be NULL.
        secretKeyAlgorithm - the encryption algorithm. CANNOT BE NULL.
        secretKey - the secret to use for the key. Gets converted to bytes. CANNOT be NULL.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the algorithm cannot be found. Should not happen in this case, or if the key spec is not found or if the key is invalid. Check the exception type for more details on the nature of the error.

      • EncryptedMapDecorator

        public EncryptedMapDecorator(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> decoratedMap,
                     java.lang.String hashAlgorithm,
                     byte[] salt,
                     java.lang.String secretKeyAlgorithm,
                     java.security.Key secretKey)
        Deprecated. 
        Decorates a map using the provided algorithms.

        Takes a salt and secretKey so that it can work with a distributed cache.

        Parameters:
        decoratedMap - the map to decorate. CANNOT be NULL.
        hashAlgorithm - the algorithm to use for hashing. CANNOT BE NULL.
        salt - the salt, as a String. Gets converted to bytes. CANNOT be NULL.
        secretKeyAlgorithm - the encryption algorithm. CANNOT BE NULL.
        secretKey - the secret to use. CANNOT be NULL.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the algorithm cannot be found or the iv size cant be determined.

      • getMessageDigest

        protected java.security.MessageDigest getMessageDigest()
        Deprecated. 
        Tries to clone the MessageDigest that was created during construction. If the clone fails that is remembered and from that point on new MessageDigest instances will be created on every call.

        Adopted from the Spring EhCache Annotations project.

        Returns:
        Generates a MessageDigest to use
